PresentationDetailsList.Name: VIRT9034 - Oracle Databases Licensing on a Hyper-Converged Platform
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Advances in technology now have IT organizations evaluating hyper-converged solutions in lieu of building systems. Hyper-converged solutions integrate computers, networking, virtualization, flash storage, and management in one platform that accelerates deployment. In this session, we evaluate each component layer of these new hyper-converged technologies per the Oracle contract, with an eye to reducing rather than increasing database licensing quantities. We drill down on VMware Corporation's new CPU affinity statement, present the inverse relationship of DR reliability and licensing liability, point to relevant content in the May 2016 House of Brick/EMC/VMware database licensing white paper, and discuss the ramifications of the October 2015 Mars vs. Oracle lawsuit. Attending this session will give IT organizations a clear roadmap in how to manage database licensing, and next steps in the case additional resources are needed. The session concludes with a 15-minute block dedicated to answering your questions. Renowned Oracle Database licensing consultancy House of Brick hosts this session with co-presenter EMC. DBAs and others attending this session will have the knowledge to apply licensing guidelines on hyper-converged platforms like the VCE Vblock 740.

Presenters.Name: Nathan Biggs, House of Brick Technologies
Presenters.LastName: Nathan Biggs, House of Brick Technologies

PresentationDetailsList.Name: VIRT8443 - Extreme Performance Series: Evaluate the Performance of Your Cloud with Weathervane and VMware vRealize Operations
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Is your private, public, or hybrid cloud performing to your expectations? Do you have a defined baseline for optimal application performance in your cloud environments? Application performance depends on a wide variety of factors: CPU, network and storage capabilities, overhead incurred by deploying in containers versus virtual machines, and even the speed with which you can spin up new instances to adapt to changing workloads. In order to make data-driven decisions about the selection and configuration of your infrastructure and deployment of your applications, you need tools that allow you to stress the environment in real-world ways, and measure resulting performance. In this talk we will discuss Weathervane, a performance exploration and benchmarking tool from VMware, which, together with VMware vRealize Operations Manager (vROps), can be be used to understand performance characteristics of your cloud or virtual infrastructure. Weathervaneprovides a flexible, easy-to-use benchmarking environment where you can execute load-driven scenarios containing complex multi-tier applications that can be deployed both in virtual machines and Docker containers. vROps enables you to monitor the performance characteristics of the applications and of your infrastructure in order to identify bottlenecks and represent the data needed to maximize cloud performance and efficiency. This session will provide an overview of the capabilities of Weathervaneand vROps, then demonstrate real-world scenarios that show how these tools can be used to characterize the performance of applications and virtual infrastructure. The example scenarios will identify storage bottlenecks, evaluate deployment technologies, find application-level bottlenecks, and determine the effect of infrastructure characteristics on application elasticity. You will leave this talk with an understanding of how to use Weathervaneand vROps to measure and optimize the performance of your applications and cloud infrastructure.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: VIRT7620 - Successfully Virtualize and Operate Your Microsoft Skype for Business Infrastructure on the VMware vSphere Platform
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Messaging, communication, and collaboration services that are highly scalable, available, and resilient are absolute necessities for any modern business enterprise. Microsoft Skype for Business (formerly Microsoft Lync Server) is one of the popular enterprise-level applications for achieving these goals. Concurrently, many enterprises have widely adopted virtualization as their main platform for most applications, and many more have corporate policies mandating application virtualization as a standard practice. Unfortunately, virtualizing Microsoft Skype for Business remains largely uncharted territory for most organizations, especially given the scarcity of the appropriate guidance and recommendations from the respective vendors.

Presenters.Name: Adam Ball, Strategic Products and Services
Presenters.LastName: Adam Ball, Strategic Products and Services

PresentationDetailsList.Name: VIRT7941 - The Best of Both Words: Achieving SQL Server High Availability with VMware
PresentationDetailsList.Description: SQL Server deployments on VMware must be just as reliable and available as if installed on physical servers. The challenge is that there are two layers that could be used to provide availability - the VMware feature set, as well as the traditional options available in SQL Server including clustered instances and availability groups. Choosing the right feature - or set of features - to get the job done takes careful consideration and proper planning. One important task that must be achieved is to resolve any contention between the DBAs and the virtualization administrators. This session will demystify the SQL Server availability features, correct some common misconceptions around in-guest availability for SQL Server, and show you example architectures. You will also learn the skills to navigate the political waters of SQL Server availability and hear the best practices necessary to make SQL Server rock solid under VMware to meet your company's SQL Server availability requirements.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: VIRT8290R - Monster VMs (Database Virtualization) Doing IT Right
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Databases by their very nature are Monster VMs. If Monster VMs are not virtualized properly, they will never perform well and can negatively impact the performance of other VMs on the hosts. In this presentation, we teach you how to properly virtualize Monster VM Databases. We will discuss why you virtualize, installation issues, how to architect for performance, the storage layer, the processor, memory considerations, and the network layer. Topics include NUMA, memory reservations, and how to avoid common mistakes. Lesson learned here help you optimize any workload you are virtualizing, with special emphasis on Monster VMs.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: VIRT7699 - Use Cases in Performance Root Cause Resolution for SQL Server: How to Use vRealize Operations Manager, SIOS iQ Machine Learning Analytics, and SQL Sentry Performance Advisor
PresentationDetailsList.Description: You need to ensure that your SQL Server meets stringent service level requirements for performance, efficiency, and availability. SIOS Technology Chief Technology Officer Sergey Razin will provide best practices steps for identifying and resolving an application performance issue in SQL Server. Using a new integrated workflow, you can identity SQL Server performance issues in VMware vRealize Operations Manager, characterize infrastructure root causes and recommended solutions with SIOS iQ machine learning analytics solutions, and define application-specific root causes with SQL Sentry Performance Advisor.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: VIRT8182 - Virtualizing Internet of Things with SAP HANA in a Flash
PresentationDetailsList.Description: The Internet of Things (IOT) is growing exponentially and has now matured to the point that it is getting a lot of attention with many solutions in this space. SAP HANA offers great promise for storing and processing data from IOT applications. In this session, we look at how virtualization of SAP HANA on All Flash storage can leverage dynamic tiering for storing and processing IOT data. We also look at some examples of business analytics with SAP Lumira to visualize and analyze IOT data. The speakers will discuss: - Requirements and profile of Internet of Things applications - Processing and storing IOT data in SAP HANA - Lessons learned from deploying and running SAP HANA on VMware - Leverage VMware capabilities for hosting and processing IOT applications - SAP Dynamic Tiering capabilities combined with All Flash storage to optimize memory footprint of IOT databases - Business analytics for IOT data

PresentationDetailsList.Name: VIRT9009 - Licensing SQL Server and Oracle  on vSphere
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Oracle and SQL Server databases are licensed very differently from other applications, with many options from which to choose depending on requirements for features, mobility needs, virtualization/consolidation targets, and usage of third-party cloud resources. This breakout session will help you understand the options available to license Oracle and SQL Server database virtual machines. Learn to maximize your database licensing investment while maintaining mobility and minimizing risks of an audit.

Presenters.Name: David Welch, House of Brick Technologies
Presenters.LastName: David Welch, House of Brick Technologies

PresentationDetailsList.Name: VIRT7598 - Extreme Performance Series: Monster VM Database Performance
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Mission-critical applications represent the last hurdle to organizations looking to migrate their data centers to the cloud. Although IT administrators realize the benefits of virtualization, they may be hesitant to virtualize applications such as databases because of their resource demands, and may even fear that the underlying hypervisor will prevent the infrastructure from meeting the SLAs of these applications. VMware vSphere, the industry's leading hypervisor platform, has been pushing the boundaries of infrastructure resources it can manage over various releases. With its superior resource management capabilities, vSphere can easily scale horizontally to support many virtual machines (VMs) or vertically to support large VMs. vSphere 6 introduces the ability to run virtual machines with up to 128 virtual CPUs (vCPUs) and 4TB of RAM, allowing extreme resource-hungry applications such as databases to be run in VMs. In this talk, the speakers give an overview of key vSphere features such as CPU and NUMA schedulers, and memory managers that propel monster VMs. The speakers will share their benchmark results, experience gained, and lessons learned. A deep dive into Oracle and SQL Server scalability on vSphere 6 on a large, multi-core physical host (4 CPU, 1 TB RAM) will be presented. Finally, the speakers will provide best practices to the audience for undertaking such an exercise. This talk should alleviate any hesitation to migrate resource-hungry, mission-critical database applications to a private cloud.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: VIRT7840 - VMware and Microsoft Present: Successfully Virtualizing Microsoft Exchange Server, the Right Way
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Microsoft Exchange Server is the most widely deployed email system in the world. Today, organizations not only use Exchange for email communication, it has also become the source of scheduling, contact information, and much to the dismay of administrators, file storage and collaboration. For this reason, Exchange must be highly available, well-performing, and deployed on a robust platform that can scale and adjust to the changing needs of an organization. Understanding the best approaches required to accomplish these goals can be daunting, and the task is made more complicated when dealing with conflicting guidance and prescriptions from the respective vendors. Microsoft and VMware are combining efforts to help our joint customers avoid these challenges by providing comprehensive, concise, and streamlined prescriptive guidance and recommendations founded on our combined expertise and experience in the relevant technologies and solutions.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: VIRT9402-SPO - Modern Storage Strategies for On-Demand Applications
PresentationDetailsList.Description:
If software is eating the world, SaaS is eating software. Modern businesses are re-writing the rules of application delivery and deployment. As application development cycles become more agile to accommodate rapidly evolving business requirements, enterprises increasingly rely on flexible, scalable cloud delivered applications. Strategies for building modern infrastructures for cloud-delivered applications must be rooted in flexibility, agility, and scalability.

This discussion will explore how datacenter technologies like virtualization, containerization, and highly scalable database platforms drive and enable IT infrastructure that delivers applications-as-a-service. SaaS businesses’ pay-as-you go model requires virtualization at the compute layer for servers and desktops. Scaling up and down, to meet application user demand requires flexible compute deployments that greatly benefit from containerization. As the data foundation for the online business, storage must deliver scale and performance as the compute paradigm evolves, while cost-effectively providing continuous data availability.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: VIRT8074 - The SDDC: Full Stack on vSphere 6.0 SAP Business Warehouse Powered By HANA, NSX,  vRealize Operations, SDS-Virtual Volumes on Hitachi Unified Platform
PresentationDetailsList.Description: This Software-Defined Data Center is no longer a concept, it is reality. In this session, we fully virtualize an industry-leading mission critical application and database; SAP Business Warehouse Powered By HANA running SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications. We will go beyond the use of vSphere 6 to virtualize compute and extend this reference architecture to cover virtual networks and software-defined storage. We will cover the rationale and specific use case behind VMware NSX micro-segmentations for mission-critical architectures. We will define and create software-defined storage via VMware Virtual Volumes, using the Hitachi Unified Compute Platform. In addition we will show the value of vRealize Operations in conjunction with the Blue Medora SAP HANA Management Pack plug-in for vROPs for the management of mission-critical workloads.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: VIRT9435-SPO - Accelerate, Simplify and Control: Add Data Virtualization to Your Enterprise
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Tired of the constant struggle with storage for virtualized architectures? Data virtualization offers a solution by abstracting data from underlying hardware to create a universal VASA provider that makes existing and new storage resources—from server-side flash to NAS and cloud storage—VVOL-capable. This universal VASA provider simplifies data management by giving admins a single VVOL datastore to manage that spans all storage resources. DataSphere also simplifies storage management by placing data on the ideal storage resource to meet the performance, price, and protection objectives of VM data. Smart Data Mobility moves data proactively and non-disruptively to improve QoS and minimize costs as business needs change.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: VIRT7511 - Performance Tuning and Monitoring for Virtualized Database Servers
PresentationDetailsList.Description:
Business-critical database platforms like Oracle and Microsoft SQL Server are among the last holdouts to enterprise virtualization, and the first to exhibit symptoms of infrastructure challenges. Is your VMware environment ready to accommodate them properly? Are your DBAs ready to virtualize them? Have you virtualized these, and now the DBAs complain about performance or lack of control? Successful virtualization of these platforms requires a different approach to virtualization than for other applications. 

The speakers will share their years of experience in virtualizing these data platforms so that you know how to validate your VMware environment for these systems and manage the performance properly. 

Scalability concerns will be addressed through discussions on scaling an individual database VM upwards and outwards as you manage the lifecycle of these database VMs. 

Key talking points will be presented so you can not only perfect the database virtualization from a technical level, but also from an organizational and people level by knowing how to convince the DBA that database virtualization -- done right -- is here to stay.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: VIRT8738 - Extreme Performance Series: Virtualized Big Data Performance Best Practices
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Optimizing performance of Big Data applications running on VSphere, while preserving the operational benefits of virtualization, involves a good understanding of both the Big Data technology - Hadoop, Hive, Spark, etc. - as well as of virtualization. Using several real-world industry-standard workloads, this session will demonstrate all aspects of achieving the best performance from a virtualized Big Data cluster, including the hardware configuration, software selection, and Hadoop parameter tuning. Operational issues in a production environment such as rapid cluster deployment and high availability will be reviewed in the context of virtualization.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: VIRT7575 - Architecting NSX with Business Critical Applications for Security, Automation and Business Continuity
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Network virtualization with NSX provides a solution for security, automation and application continuity challenges. As part of the VMware Business Critical Applications team we meet application owners and DBA at our customers who often ask, how can network virtualization benefits be applied to their SAP applications or Oracle and SQL databases? What does NSX mean to the business critical application owner? In this session we will show how we can utilize NSX to make the app owners and the DBA life easier and more secure, by dynamically enforcing security, streamlining app deployment and providing networking services across sites.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: VIRT8278 - Snapshots and SQL Server - Technical Deep Dive and Detailed Lab Findings
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Snapshots: Application-consistent, crash-consistent, VSS, Quiesced... what does it all mean from a technical perspective, and how does it apply to Microsoft SQL Server? Snapshotting technologies are at the heart of data protection for Microsoft SQL Server, whether for backups, quick point-in-time restores, or full disaster recovery planning... know your risks! Discover through detailed lab testing how various snapshot technologies can protect your data and deep dive into specific (and often hidden!) risks of data inconsistency and corruption.

Presenters.Name: Shawn Meyers, House of Brick Technologies
Presenters.LastName: Shawn Meyers, House of Brick Technologies

PresentationDetailsList.Name: VIRT9459-SPO - High Performance Software Defined Data Center for Business Critical Applications
PresentationDetailsList.Description: In this session, top architects on virtualization, SDDC, storage and networking from VMware, SanDisk and Brocade will share reference configurations that are tested to run today top business analytics software and workloads. The team will share compelling use cases and newest reference configurations for deploying business intelligence and analytics applications in the SDDC based on all-flash and hybrid Virtual SAN, and VMware NSX. Topic of discussion will include deployment architecture to make this reference configuration highly available by leveraging VMware, Brocade and Western Digital products and technologies. Session Outline: Lessons Learned from deploying and running business intelligence and analytic applications and databases in the SDDC with Virtual SAN Reference configurations for running business intelligence and analytic software with databases such as SQL Server and Oracle on all-flash and hybrid Virtual SAN How to use VMware NSX to build overlay network necessary to support business applications running in SDDC environment Configuring and setting up your vSphere, Virtual SAN, NSX, storage and networking infrastructure optimally to run business intelligence and analytic applications Configuring and setting up for application mobility across data centers using all-flash Virtual SAN cluster at the primary site and hybrid Virtual SAN cluster for a remote location Discuss best practices to deploy overlay network based on VMware NSX, extend network across primary site and remote location based on L2/L3 extension, Global Load Balancer and the physical network to support above requirements based on Brocade agile Datacenter networking technologies How vRealize Operations Manager and vRealize Log Insight based Brocade solutions provides visibility and helps to monitor underlying network to support SDDC infrastructure

Presenters.Name: Anuj Dewangan, Brocade Communications Systems, Inc.
Presenters.LastName: Anuj Dewangan, Brocade Communications Systems, Inc.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: VIRT7684 - SAP on Virtual SAN
PresentationDetailsList.Description:
Running virtualized SAP applications and databases is becoming the standard deployment option in modern data centers and IT operations. By leveraging VMware virtualization products, customers benefit from increased security and built-in multi-tenancy support, abstraction of the hardware layer, higher hardware utilization rates, and easier management by, for instance, live migration of running SAP applications and databases. All this is lowering the total cost of ownership and providing better SLAs and flexibility. With Virtual SAN 6 and newer, VMware now provides the next step in infrastructure virtualization. By leveraging server internal disks and flash devices, very cost-efficient enterprise-ready virtual SAN storage configurations can be built and operated. 

In this session, a test and demo environment of four server systems, configured with all flash Virtual SAN datastores, will be presented to show how easy and cost efficient it is to provide a IOPS cluster capacity of over 180,000 IOPS for a typical SAP workload, with 4/8k blocks and 70% read and 30% write operations, and IO latencies of 4 concurrent high loaded running VMs below 610 microseconds. We will also explain in detail how to configure a SAP Virtual SAN environment that fulfills the IO performance, reliability, and business requirements organizations request to operate SAP systems that are cost efficient, reliable, and secure. We will provide best practices and lessons learned. A SAP-specific sizing example concludes this session.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: VIRT8530R - Deep Dive on pNUMA & vNUMA - Save Your SQL VMs from Certain DoomA!
PresentationDetailsList.Description: There's more to non-uniform memory access (NUMA) than physical boundaries in your server hardware. Putting the DEEP back into Deep Dive, Rob and Shawn will use this session to deliver everything you ever wanted to know about pNUMA & vNUMA settings within VMware vSphere, Windows, & SQL Server to aid you in getting the settings right to maximize performance. In addition to an overview on NUMA, we'll discuss some nuances of NUMA that are not commonly known, effects of memory & CPU hot-add, selecting cores vs. sockets for your VMs, default calculation behavior, performance penalties for getting it wrong, and MORE!

Presenters.Name: Shawn Meyers, House of Brick Technologies
Presenters.LastName: Shawn Meyers, House of Brick Technologies

PresentationDetailsList.Name: VIRT7550 - Providing HA and DR to Mission Critical Oracle Databases using vSphere Metro Storage Cluster and VMware Software defined Storage and Networking
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware's Software-Defined Storage (SDS) combined with Software-Defined Networking brings simplicity, efficiency, and cost-savings, along with ease of setting up high availability (HA) and disaster recovery (DR) strategies for essential mission-critical databases. Combining this technology with extended-distance Oracle Real Application Clusters ensures 100% uptime for business-critical applications, with ease of setup at a much lower cost. Storage virtualization, both host-based and appliance-based, can pave the way for increased ease of configuration and improved availability of your cluster-based applications. Network virtualization using NSX can provide the much-needed zero trust security, along with layer 2 adjacency for extended distance Oracle Real Application Clusters. Other storage virtualization technologies such as EMC VPLEX, NetApp Metro Cluster, IBM SVC, HP 3PAR Peer Persistence, and Oracle Automatic Storage Management (ASM) disk groups will also be discussed. Site Recovery Manager with Oracle Data Guard can provide an essential disaster recovery component, thereby providing a complete HA and DR solution to Business Critical Databases. See how one Global 1000 company used storage virtualization to achieve 0-second RPO and 5-second RTO. Listen to a customer real-life example of how deploying Extended Distance Oracle Real Application Clusters on vSphere has improved his HA strategy.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: VIRT8708 - Understanding Difficult Applications that Require Extra TLC for Better Performance
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Today, everyone should be confident that they can virtualize even their most challenging Tier-1 applications on vSphere. We will demonstrate that even the most demanding applications, e.g. a monster VM running Oracle OLTP, can run on vSphere at near-native performance right out-of-the-box. But not all applications are created equal. Some still pose a significant challenge to virtualize based on how they're written or in their hardware interactions. We will explore these unique applications, their impact on virtual hardware, and present recommendations for maximizing their performance on vSphere.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: VIRT7709 - Innovations from Cloudera and VMware for Virtualizing Hadoop
PresentationDetailsList.Description: This joint talk, to be given by Cloudera and VMware speakers, explores the technical partnership between the companies to integrate the two technologies for deploying and managing big data on vSphere. The talk will give details of the Cloudera Director integration with VMware vCenter for provisioning and will explore details of relevant reference architectures that may be used to effectively deploy Cloudera's CDH platform onto VMware vSphere. An early adopter customer will be engaged to speak about their reasons for adoption of virtualized Hadoop, if available. A short introduction to best practices for Hadoop on vSphere will also be given.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: VIRT8071 - Making Virtualized Hadoop Deployments Successful
PresentationDetailsList.Description:
Managing Hadoop in itself is already a huge undertaking. Adding in VMware vSphere to make Hadoop work in a virtualized environment is another layer of operations. Between the two platforms, there could be tens of thousands of parameters to be tweaked and managed to make sure that optimal configurations are applied across the stack. Some parameters will be more critical than others. Understanding where the parameters need to be capped is also important.

Having Hadoop admin and vSphere admin establish a cohesive support model is key to managing the Hadoop platform successfully. Developing the engagement model between the two will streamline the support process, and they will be able to have predictable SLAs in supporting the business.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: VIRT7654 - SQL Server on vSphere: A Panel with Some of the World's Most Renowned Experts
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Learn from real-life experience about virtualizing the most demanding SQL Servers from some of world's most renowned SQL Server experts! In this panel discussion, you also have the chance to ask your own questions about SQL Server on vSphere practices and get your answers from the SQL Server gurus.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: VIRT9923-SPO - Virtual SQL Server for the Non-DBA
PresentationDetailsList.Description: If you are an administrator or developer who has just been handed a Microsoft SQL Server database, and you've got no idea what to do with it—this session has answers for you. You will learn how to manage SQL Server and keep it running, safe and secure. We will review the tools that SQL Server and VMware provides us for database management and performance monitoring. A variety of important topics will be covered including regular operational tasks, database backups, and database restores. You will learn how to maintain a database so that it runs at peak performance, and how to identify and isolate the cause of common performance problems, including database layout, indexing, host latency, networks, and storage bottlenecks. Instructions are provided on how to properly backup a database so that you can recover it after a failure, and you will learn how to look for and correct database corruption. After this session you will be armed with the basic insights you need to confidently run, maintain, backup, and restore virtualized SQL Server databases.

Presenters.Name: Denham Cherry, Denny Cherry & Associates Consulting
Presenters.LastName: Denham Cherry, Denny Cherry & Associates Consulting

PresentationDetailsList.Name: VIRT8530R - Deep Dive on pNUMA & vNUMA - Save Your SQL VMs from Certain DoomA!
PresentationDetailsList.Description: There's more to non-uniform memory access (NUMA) than physical boundaries in your server hardware. Putting the DEEP back into Deep Dive, Rob and Shawn will use this session to deliver everything you ever wanted to know about pNUMA & vNUMA settings within VMware vSphere, Windows, & SQL Server to aid you in getting the settings right to maximize performance. In addition to an overview on NUMA, we'll discuss some nuances of NUMA that are not commonly known, effects of memory & CPU hot-add, selecting cores vs. sockets for your VMs, default calculation behavior, performance penalties for getting it wrong, and MORE!

Presenters.Name: Shawn Meyers, House of Brick Technologies
Presenters.LastName: Shawn Meyers, House of Brick Technologies

PresentationDetailsList.Name: VIRT7931 - SAP on SDDC: Business Benefits of SAP Automation with SDDC
PresentationDetailsList.Description: SAP-run businesses benefit greatly by being run in a Software-Defined Data Center (SDDC).  This session will discuss the many ways that SDDC helps your business save costs and time by using SAP Automation with SDDC.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: VIRT9132 - Virtualized Extended Distance RAC on Hyperconverged Infrastructure in a Private Cloud - The Perfect Marriage of Availability and On-demand Scalability
PresentationDetailsList.Description: The advent of hyperconverged architecture has taken much of the pain and large capital outlay out of desktop virtualization. What are the implications for business-critical applications? In this case study, we show how one organization made their Oracle databases and associated applications highly available and vastly scalable, leveraging the virtues of extended-distance RAC built on SimpliVity OmniCube appliances.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: VIRT8198 - Automating Deployments of Mission-Critical Applications - in a Flash!
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Providing for and maintaining multiple copies of a large production database across different platforms have always been a challenge. Traditionally this has been done using backup and recovery or copying snapshots of the database to refresh the different copies of the database.This session looks at how VMware vRealize automation combined with All Flash Storage can revolutionize database operations and business intelligence applications. Maintaining high performance, efficient environments for mission-critical applications can be a huge challenge for IT departments. Balancing high availability for production operations with agility for application development efforts can be extremely tricky. Developers need fast access to the latest application configurations and data to ensure that new apps/services are delivered to specification. IT departments have to find a way to maintain business SLAs, while supporting innovation through developer agility. In this session, we will explore an architectural model, with vRealize Automation and All Flash Storage, that allows IT departments to support production application SLAs, while at the same time driving higher levels of developer agility to drive innovation. The speakers will discuss: - Challenges with day-to-day operations for enterprise applications - Some unique characteristics of vRealize Automation and Pure Storage FlashArray that can help with application operations - Real examples with Oracle DB, EBS, OBIEE and SAP HANA

PresentationDetailsList.Name: VIRT7632 - SQL Server On-Premises in the Cloud
PresentationDetailsList.Description:
In this session, we'll look at deployment options both on-premises and within a variety of cloud environments including vCloud, Azure, and AWS.

We will discuss best practices for deploying SQL Server and using SQL Server within a variety environments including dedicated environments within vSphere, as well as hybrid deployments where the on-premises environment is stretched to vSloud, Azure, or AWS.

Presenters.Name: Denham Cherry, Denny Cherry & Associates Consulting
Presenters.LastName: Denham Cherry, Denny Cherry & Associates Consulting

PresentationDetailsList.Name: VIRT7507 - How to Design and Tune Virtualized Trading Platforms
PresentationDetailsList.Description: With recent advances in VMware vSphere 6 performance, we continue to see some of the most serious application workloads being virtualized. It is no longer an issue whether a tier-1 workload can be virtualized, but rather there are companies that are betting their tier-0 on the VMware stack. Société Générale (formerly NewEdge) is one such company, with their main trading platform called NVision running on a fully virtualized cluster servicing some 20 million trades per day. This session will cover various platform architectures that are used, with deep dive into the cluster design for this trading platform. The session will share many best practices and actual examples used with customers that are running such high-end platforms. Specifically, Java Garbage Collection, in-memory databases, vSphere tuning techniques, and rationalization of large deployments having 1000s of VMs and JVMs will be discussed. Come to this session to learn about GC tuning and vSphere recipes that can give you the best configuration for latency sensitive applications for high-end performance platforms.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: VIRT8530R - Deep Dive on pNUMA & vNUMA - Save Your SQL VMs from Certain DoomA!
PresentationDetailsList.Description: There's more to non-uniform memory access (NUMA) than physical boundaries in your server hardware. Putting the DEEP back into Deep Dive, Rob and Shawn will use this session to deliver everything you ever wanted to know about pNUMA & vNUMA settings within VMware vSphere, Windows, & SQL Server to aid you in getting the settings right to maximize performance. In addition to an overview on NUMA, we'll discuss some nuances of NUMA that are not commonly known, effects of memory & CPU hot-add, selecting cores vs. sockets for your VMs, default calculation behavior, performance penalties for getting it wrong, and MORE!

Presenters.Name: Shawn Meyers, House of Brick Technologies
Presenters.LastName: Shawn Meyers, House of Brick Technologies

PresentationDetailsList.Name: VIRT9366-QT - Business Critical Applications at VMware and DBaaS with the Hybrid Cloud
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware vSphere has been a viable option for deploying Business Critical Applications and Databases like Oracle and SQL Server since vSphere 4 released in 2009. With the release of vSphere 6 in 2015 it is fair to say that every application and database in existence is a candidate for virtualized infrastructure. There are many types of applications and databases and VMware has just as many approaches to running them all in the SDDC. Also these databases and database applications can be offered through self‐service portal architectures, all of which can be managed through a Database-as-a-Service approach that eliminate or minimize IT intervention. Providing multiple copies of relational database servers for testing and development is often a complex operation but through hybrid cloud architectures this model can be extremely effective and efficient. This session will discuss the overall VMware approach to BCA as well as the notions of DbaaS.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: VIRT8239-QT - Things You Should Know about Big Data
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Big Data is one of the most fast-moving technologies that supports new disruptive businesses. We will share the new technologies in Big Data from infrastructure up to applications.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: VIRT7504-QT - Deploying SAP Netweaver and HANA with vSphere 6 and Latest Solutions in the VMware SDDC
PresentationDetailsList.Description: In the last year, there have been major new releases and solutions within the VMware platform including vSphere 6, NSX, integrated monitoring, and VMware Virtual Volumes. These advancements define new boundaries for scalability and management of virtualized SAP landscapes. This session will cover different use cases of SAP and HANA with these latest features and solutions. Topics will include:  - How NSX can manage security of the multi-tier SAP landscape - HA options for virtual HANA and Netweaver, including 3rd Party Cluster Solutions and the case for VMware FT - Monitoring SAP with latest updates in vRealize Operations 6.X - Impact of all flash arrays and VVOLs on SAP database storage design - Sizing, scaling, NUMA design of VMs on large multi-socket x86 servers
